name: EVSE
description: EVSE data which extends OCPI EVSE

fields.name: uid
fields.description:
Uniquely identifies an EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database ID or the actual "EVSE ID". This field can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the 'technical' identification of the EVSE, not to be used as 'human readable' identification, use the field evse_id for that.
This field is named uid instead of id, because id could be confused with evse_id which is an eMI3 defined field.

fields.name: evse_id
fields.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) "Part 2: business objects." Optional because: if an evse_id is to be re-used in the real world, the evse_id can be removed from an EVSE object if the status is set to REMOVED.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Indicates the current status of an EVSE.

fields.name: status_schedule
fields.description: Indicates a planned status update of a nEVSE.

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: List of functionalities that an EVSE is capable of.

fields.name: connectors
fields.description: List of available connectors on an EVSE.

fields.name: floor_level
fields.description: Level on which a Charge Point is located (in garage buildings) in the locally displayed numbering scheme.

fields.name: physical_reference
fields.description: A number/string printed on the outside of an EVSE for visual identification.

fields.name: parking_restrictions
fields.description: Restrictions that apply to a parking spot.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Links to images related to an EVSE such as photos or logos.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this EVSE or one of its Connectors was last updated (or created).

fields.name: parking_cost
fields.description: Indicates if parking is free or paid.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer
